columns.name: ODS_ID
columns.description: Uniquely constructed identifier

columns.name: ODS_CATALOG_ID
columns.description: Uniquely constructed identifier using concatenation of class number and term code

columns.name: ODS_CATALOG_NUMBER
columns.description: The course catalog number assigned by the school.

columns.name: ODS_CATALOG_NUMBER_INT
columns.description: The varchar portion of the course catalog number (i.e. '100' for French 100A, '0' for French A)

columns.name: ODS_CATALOG_NUMBER_CHAR
columns.description: The character portion of the course catalog number (i.e. 'A' for French 100A)

columns.name: ODS_CATALOG_NUMBER_SORT
columns.description: The entire catalog number converted to a long string with leading zeros, to be used to ensure an accurate sorting of courses by mixed catalog numbers.

columns.name: ODS_CLASS_NUMBER
columns.description: A 6 digit number assigned to each class by my.harvard that is unique by term (across all Academic Careers).  Class Number and Term Code can often be used as an Alternate Key in retrieving data about class.

columns.name: ODS_INSTRUCTOR_LAST_FIRST
columns.description: Sortaable name constructed by Last Name, First Name

columns.name: ODS_COURSE_DESCRLONG
columns.description: Long Course description

columns.name: ODS_TERM_CODE
columns.description: Long Course description

columns.name: ODS_SUBJECT
columns.description: The subject of the class.  Defaulted from the course at class creation, but can be overridden on a specific class.

columns.name: ODS_SUBJECT_DESCR
columns.description: The description of the subject.

columns.name: ODS_ACADEMIC_YEAR
columns.description: The academic year of the term.

columns.name: ODS_COURSE_TITLE_LONG
columns.description: The Course title effective as of the start date of the term this class is offered.

columns.name: ODS_COMPONENT_CODE
columns.description: The class component such as Lecture, Discussion, Lab.

columns.name: ODS_COMPONENT_DESCR
columns.description: The description of the component.

columns.name: ODS_CLASS_ACAD_ORG
columns.description: Generally the department that owns the class. However, academic orgs are arrayed in a tree of School -> Division -> Department,  and a class may be associated with any part of the tree.  For example, a  class may be associated with the FAS academic org.  Additionally, class academic org defaults from the course catalog at class creation, but may be overridden at the class level.

columns.name: ODS_CLASS_ACAD_ORG_DESCR
columns.description: Description of the Class's academic org.

columns.name: ODS_SUBJECT_ACAD_ORG
columns.description: The department that owns the subject code.  The subject's academic org may differ from class's academic org for multiple reasons.  One example is in the case of SEAS classes.  We indicate which classes are owned by SEAS with the Class Academic Org.  However, if you want to know the specific SEAS department, look at the Subject's Academic Org.

columns.name: ODS_SUBJECT_ACAD_ORG_DESCR
columns.description: Description of the Subject's academic org.

columns.name: ODS_GRADING_BASIS
columns.description: The grading basis for this class.  The grading basis code will either represent a single grade basis, such as Letter Graded or Audit, or a code that gives students an option to choose from a pre-defined list of grading bases at enrollment time.  Different programs can make different grading bases available to catalog coordinators based on grading scheme.

columns.name: ODS_GRADING_BASIS_DESCR
columns.description: The descripton of the grading basis.

columns.name: ODS_CLASS_TYPE
columns.description: The indicator of whether this class is an Enrollment section or not.  Enrollment sections are the ones that will be assigned grades.

columns.name: ODS_CLASS_TYPE_DESCR
columns.description: The description of the Class Type code.

columns.name: ODS_COURSE_DESCR
columns.description: Short course description

columns.name: ODS_ENROLLMENT_COUNT
columns.description: Total Enrollment Count by Term, Class and Class Section

columns.name: ODS_FINAL_EXAM
columns.description: Y/N flag that indicates if the course has a final exam

columns.name: ODS_CLASS_START_DATE
columns.description: Date on which the class starts

columns.name: ODS_CLASS_END_DATE
columns.description: Date on which the class ends

columns.name: ODS_UNITS_MAXIMUM
columns.description: The maximum number of units for a class.

columns.name: ODS_UNITS_MINIMUM
columns.description: The minimum number of units for a class.

columns.name: ODS_I_COURSE_ID
columns.description: The unique 6-digit number assigned to each course by my.harvard (from a sequence)

columns.name: ODS_I_COURSE_OFFER_NUMBER
columns.description: An individual course course be offered simultaneously by different careers or under different catalog numbers

columns.name: ODS_I_TERM
columns.description: The term that a course offering will be held

columns.name: ODS_I_TERM_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: The description of the term code above

columns.name: ODS_I_SESSION_CODE
columns.description: Sessions are time frames defined within a term

columns.name: ODS_I_CLASS_SECTION
columns.description: A text field to identify different sections of a class within a term and session

columns.name: ODS_I_CLASS_MEETING_NUMBER
columns.description: The number representing the unique class meeting pattern

columns.name: ODS_I_INSTRUCTOR_SEQUENCE
columns.description: A number generated to unique identify the instructors per class meeting.

columns.name: ODS_I_INSTRUCTOR_ID
columns.description: The HUID of the instructor.

columns.name: ODS_I_INSTRUCTOR_ROLE
columns.description: The instructors role code.  Roles include instructors, Teaching Assistants, Teaching Fellows, Course Coordinators, etc.

columns.name: ODS_I_INSTRUCTOR_ROLE_DESCR
columns.description: The description of the instructor's role code.

columns.name: ODS_I_INSTRUCTOR_NAME
columns.description: The preferred name of the Instructor, if defined.  If not, the Primary Name.

columns.name: ODS_I_ACADEMIC_CAREER
columns.description: The class's Academic Career.

columns.name: ODS_I_BRACKETED_FLAG
columns.description: FAS Specific field:  Y if this course is not scheduled for the term, but is likely to be scheduled.  N otherwise. Bracketed courses returned are only those effective as of start date of the FAS current term.

columns.name: TERM_CODE
columns.description: BOTH. sterm instead of term and term num.

columns.name: SUBJECT_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: BOTH. Subject description as of the term's start date.

columns.name: CATALOG_NUMBER
columns.description: BOTH. Just the catalog number portion.

columns.name: CATALOG_NUMBER_INT
columns.description: BOTH. The leading integers of the catalog number. For 50A, this would be 50. For '1.34', this would be 1.

columns.name: CATALOG_NUMBER_CHAR
columns.description: BOTH. Everything from the first non-number character to the right. For 50A, this would be A. For '1.34', this would be '.34'

columns.name: CLASS_SHORT_NAME
columns.description: BOTH. In my.harvard this is subject + catalog number.

columns.name: COURSE_ID
columns.description: BOTH. Course ID

columns.name: COMPONENT_CODE
columns.description: component code in my.harvard

columns.name: COMPONENT_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: course type

columns.name: COURSE_LEVEL_DESCR
columns.description: Both. Course Level Description

columns.name: COURSE_TITLE_LONG
columns.description: Both. Course Title

columns.name: CLASS_NUMBER
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. In my.harvard ODS data, class_number + term_code + EMPLID + academic_career (excluded) will be unique. In historic data, course_id + term_code + emplid will be unique.

columns.name: CLASS_TYPE
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. E = enrollment section, N = non enrollment section. All historic data is 'E' data only.

columns.name: SESSION_CODE
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. The portion of the term a class is held. 1 = Full Term. As of now, all FAS classes are scheduled for the full term.

columns.name: CLASS_SECTION
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. A string to uniquely identify each section.

columns.name: EID
columns.description: Unique Key long = Research UUID + Term ID + Class Number. To be used for updating my.harvard data

columns.name: EID_COURSE
columns.description: Unique Key = Research UUID + Term ID + Course ID. To be used for updating historic data

columns.name: EID_LONG
columns.description: Unique Key long = Research UUID + Academic Career + Institution + Term ID + Class Number. To be used for updating my.harvard data

columns.name: CID
columns.description: Course Key = Term ID + Class No. To be used for updating my.harvard data

columns.name: CID_COURSE
columns.description: Course Key = Term ID + Course ID. To be used for updating historic data

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: Research ID

columns.name: ACAD_YEAR
columns.description: BOTH. Set based on course's term.

columns.name: TERM_CODE
columns.description: BOTH. sterm instead of term and term num.

columns.name: TERM_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: BOTH. provide it if you have it.

columns.name: COURSE_ID
columns.description: BOTH. Course ID

columns.name: SUBJECT_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: BOTH. Subject description as of the term's start date.

columns.name: CATALOG_NUMBER
columns.description: BOTH. Just the catalog number portion.

columns.name: CATALOG_NUMBER_INT
columns.description: BOTH. The leading integers of the catalog number. For 50A, this would be 50. For '1.34', this would be 1.

columns.name: CATALOG_NUMBER_CHAR
columns.description: BOTH. Everything from the first non-number character to the right. For 50A, this would be A. For '1.34', this would be '.34'

columns.name: CLASS_SHORT_NAME
columns.description: BOTH. In my.harvard this is subject + catalog number.

columns.name: STDNT_ENRL_STATUS
columns.description: BOTH. In historical, this is named 'Withdrawn'. In my.harvard, this is named STDNT_ENRL_STATS. Rename in data request.

columns.name: INSTITUTION
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. Always 'HRVRD'. It's part of the key, so providing it.

columns.name: CLASS_NUMBER
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. In my.harvard ODS data, class_number + term_code + EMPLID + academic_career (excluded) will be unique. In historic data, course_id + term_code + emplid will be unique.

columns.name: COURSE_CAREER
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. The course's school. All records returned in the view today are FAS Records.

columns.name: COURSE_OFFER_NUMBER
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. If a course could be scheduled under 2 different catalog numbers, each will be given a different course_off_number.

columns.name: SESSION_CODE
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. The portion of the term a class is held. 1 = Full Term. As of now, all FAS classes are scheduled for the full term.

columns.name: CLASS_SECTION
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. A string to uniquely identify each section.

columns.name: CLASS_TYPE
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. E = enrollment section, N = non enrollment section. All historic data is 'E' data only.

columns.name: ENRL_LAST_UPDATE_DT
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. Last time any part of the enrollment record was changed.

columns.name: CLASS_LAST_UPDATE_DT
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. Last time any part of the class was changed. Note: The session_code and class_section fields MAY change on a class even after students have enrolled. The course_id, course_offer_number, and term_code will NOT change.

columns.name: YEAR_IN_SCHOOL
columns.description: NULL for Historical Dataset. Year in school code. NOTE: each school defines their own values. HGSE uses 1.1, 1.2, 2.1, etc.. HCOL uses FR,SO,JR,SR, etc..

columns.name: YEAR_IN_SCHOOL_DESCR
columns.description: NULL for historical dataset.
